text: Alexander Martínez (born 23 August 1977 in Isla de la Juventud) is a Swiss triple jumper. He changed nationality from his native Cuba in 2006. His personal best jump is 17.51 metres, achieved in July 2005 in Bern. This result places him fifth on the all-time Cuban performers list, behind Yoelbi Quesada, Lázaro Betancourt, Aliecer Urrutia and Yoandri Betanzos. While competing for Switzerland he has set a new Swiss record of 17.13 metres.Swiss athletics records ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |2002 |IAAF Grand Prix Final |Paris, France |bgcolor=cc9966 align="center" | 3rd | |- |2003 |World Athletics Final |Monte Carlo, Monaco |align="center" | 6th | |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|2006 |European Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |align="center" | 9th |16.80 |- |World Athletics Final |Stuttgart, Germany |align="center" | 4th | |} ==References== * Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Cuban male triple jumpers Category:Swiss male triple jumpers Category:Naturalised citizens of Switzerland Category:Swiss people of Cuban descent
title: Alexander Martínez
